text: <a href="../2-Samuel-18-1/" title="2 Samuel 18:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And David numbered the people that *were* with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-2/" title="2 Samuel 18:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-3/" title="2 Samuel 18:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but now *thou art* worth ten thousand of us: therefore now *it is* better that thou succour us out of the city.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-4/" title="2 Samuel 18:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And the king said unto them, What seemeth you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-5/" title="2 Samuel 18:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, *Deal* gently for my sake with the young man, *even* with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.
<a href="../2-Samuel-18-6/" title="2 Samuel 18:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim;

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-7/" title="2 Samuel 18:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand *men*.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-8/" title="2 Samuel 18:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-9/" title="2 Samuel 18:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that *was* under him went away.
<a href="../2-Samuel-18-10/" title="2 Samuel 18:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And a certain man saw *it*, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-11/" title="2 Samuel 18:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest *him*, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten *shekels* of silver, and a girdle.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-12/" title="2 Samuel 18:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand *shekels* of silver in mine hand, *yet* would I not put forth mine hand against the king's son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none *touch* the young man Absalom.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-13/" title="2 Samuel 18:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against *me*.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-14/" title="2 Samuel 18:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he *was* yet alive in the midst of the oak.
<a href="../2-Samuel-18-15/" title="2 Samuel 18:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And ten young men that bare Joab's armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-16/" title="2 Samuel 18:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-17/" title="2 Samuel 18:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a very great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-18/" title="2 Samuel 18:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar, which *is* in the king's dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called unto this day, Absalom's place.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-19/" title="2 Samuel 18:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that the LORD hath avenged him of his enemies.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-20/" title="2 Samuel 18:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not bear tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day: but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king's son is dead.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-21/" title="2 Samuel 18:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 Then said Joab to Cushi, Go tell the king what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-22/" title="2 Samuel 18:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But howsoever, let me, I pray thee, also run after Cushi. And Joab said, Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings ready?

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-23/" title="2 Samuel 18:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 But howsoever, *said he*, let me run. And he said unto him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran Cushi.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-24/" title="2 Samuel 18:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-25/" title="2 Samuel 18:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he *be* alone, *there is* tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-26/" title="2 Samuel 18:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold *another* man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-27/" title="2 Samuel 18:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He *is* a good man, and cometh with good tidings.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-28/" title="2 Samuel 18:28 KJV verse detail"><span id="30" class="versehover">28 And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed *be* the LORD thy God, which hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-29/" title="2 Samuel 18:29 KJV verse detail"><span id="31" class="versehover">29 And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king's servant, and *me* thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what *it was*.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-30/" title="2 Samuel 18:30 KJV verse detail"><span id="32" class="versehover">30 And the king said *unto him*, Turn aside, *and* stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-31/" title="2 Samuel 18:31 KJV verse detail"><span id="33" class="versehover">31 And, behold, Cushi came; and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the LORD hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-32/" title="2 Samuel 18:32 KJV verse detail"><span id="34" class="versehover">32 And the king said unto Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do *thee* hurt, be as *that* young man *is*.

<a href="../2-Samuel-18-33/" title="2 Samuel 18:33 KJV verse detail"><span id="35" class="versehover">33 And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
